intro: Lycianthes profunderugosa, commonly known as the purpleleaf nightshade, is a species of flowering plant in the nightshade family, Solanaceae. It is native to Mexico and is characterized by its dark green, deeply lobed leaves and showy, violet-blue flowers that bloom in summer. The plant produces small, round berries that are typically yellow or orange when mature. It thrives in a variety of soil types but prefers well-drained conditions and full sun. Lycianthes profunderugosa is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and flowers.
